code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient presents with mild diarrhea, mild flatulence and mild abdominal pain. he is having symptoms 8-9 times a week, in spite of treatment. he is a 45 yr old white m. he smokes one pack/day for 2 years Patient is a moderate drinker o:Height 170 cm, Weight 57.9 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 115, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 16, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Abdomen = LUQ tenderness and rebound tenderness, Heart = RRR, loud S2 a:Abdominal Pain p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed famotidine - 40 mg daily, and ordered serum calcium level.

s:pt describes moderate abdominal pain. patient is a 46 yr old white male. drinks daily he smokes one pack/day of cigarettes o:Height 170 cm, Weight 56.9 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, Abdomen = RUQ tenderness and nondistended, palpable liver a:Abdominal Pain p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and referred patient to gastroenterology.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

td.content: s:pt presents with moderate abdominal pain for 7 weeks. he is a white male philosopher aged 46 years. o:Height 169 cm, Weight 56.2 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 15, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, Abdomen = RUQ tenderness and nondistended, palpable liver a:Abdominal Pain p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered Reticulocyte Count.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination
